tei: <pb n="75"/>A “Operation Shuckburgh,” <hi rend="italic">The Bookseller</hi>, 17 February 1951, pp. 254-55. On his<lb/>transporting a Gutenberg Bible to America.<lb/>L “Happy Hundred,” <hi rend="italic">The Sunday Times</hi>, 24 April 1951, p. 4. On an exhibition at<lb/>the National Book League. See the next entry.<lb/>A “Modern Books and Writers,” <hi rend="italic">Books</hi> [National Book League] 260 (“Festival of<lb/>Britain Issue,” May 1951): 101-02. On an exhibition organized by Carter and<lb/>P. H. Muir. See the preceding entry.<lb/>D:1952-75<lb/>N [Scattered unsigned paragraphs in the “Commentary” or “News and Com-<lb/>ment” sections], <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 1-24 (1952-75). For a discussion of these<lb/>pieces, see the headnote to the handlist, above; those that have been identi-<lb/>fied are given separate entries below.<lb/>D:1952<lb/>L “Department of Modest Confusion,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 161 (1952 [19 January]):<lb/>197. Correcting the report on the National Book League exhibition in the<lb/>17 November issue: Carter was co-chair of the exhibition committee but was<lb/>not a member of the selection panel.<lb/>N “Cary: <hi rend="italic">Dante</hi>,” <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 1 (1952 [Spring]): 54. Reprinted from <hi rend="italic">Virginia Quarterly Review</hi> (D:1950).<lb/>L [Letter to Sol Malkin on the Abbey collection], <hi rend="italic">Antiquarian Bookman</hi> 10 (1952<lb/>[27 September]): 806.<lb/>R [Review of <hi rend="italic">ABC for Book-Collectors</hi>], <hi rend="italic">The Bookseller</hi>, 29 September 1952, p. 74.<lb/>Reprinted in <hi rend="italic">Antiquarian Bookman</hi> 10 (1952 [1 November]): 1195-96; in Cart-<lb/>er’s <hi rend="italic">Books and Book-Collectors</hi> (A:1956), pp. 193-96; and in <hi rend="italic">AB Bookman’s Weekly</hi><lb/>55 (1975 [7 April]): 1618, 1625-26.<lb/>N “[Ronald] Knox’s <hi rend="italic">Absolute and Abitofhell</hi>,” <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> 1 (1952 [Winter]):<lb/>268.
